snippet: Ahead of the first anniversary of his election to the papacy, Francis used a newspaper interview to depict himself as a normal person.
abstract: Pope Francis uses a newspaper interview to depict himself as a normal person who laughs, cries and misses his ailing sister; declares his frustrations with being portrayed as a superman or a star; defends Roman Catholic Church's handling of clerical pedophilia scandal and reiterates his belief that women should play a larger role in church decision making.

byline.contributor: Gaia Pianigiani contributed reporting from Castellina in Chianti, Italy.

lead_paragraph: Ahead of the first anniversary of his election to the papacy, Francis used a newspaper interview to depict himself as a normal person.

headline.main: Pope Moves to Deflate Breathless Portrayals of Stardom
headline.print_headline: Pope Moves to Deflate Breathless Portrayals of Stardom
